text: This is a little bit ancillary, but is there a way to change a system pages “type”? I have a template set up for search results, but now I’m realizing that cloning another system page doesn’t work as the type is wrong.

I just ran into this with our blog template. I was going to clone the layout and just make it a search results, then i realized you cant switch the type. Would be awesome to have this ability <#C26E7JT8V|ideas>
It's possible through the API, PUT `<http://api.hubapi.com/content/api/v2/templates/{templateId}|api.hubapi.com/content/api/v2/templates/{templateId}>` with body `{"template_type": 27}`
But I agree this should be easier to do through the UI
is there a better way to preview your search template, when i went use the preview, i got  portal not specified error but then i realized its cause it was on the preview subdomain
Yeah. You can manually specify the portalId=XXXXXXX
Not sure if it works anymore tho.
im also noticing when i make updates to the search template i literally have to leave the page and come back to see my changes made
I have to wait for it to update.. sometimes you can break cache by adding a questionmark and a random string to the end of teh url
<@U7BEP5R7T> This is a good idea. Not sure how feasible it is, but I’ve forwarded it to the team

would also be nice to have the ability to turn off autocomplete in the module settings for the search input and naturally change the search slug from `hs-search-results` to something else. Also be able to use a checkbox setting to determine what should be searched such as: posts, pages, landing pages, etc
I was thinking about returning test data if you are querying on a preview domain
<@U2H3TT8F2> I am working on being able to set the slug in search settings right now
